title: Modeling time-constrained learning in a highly interactive task
proctitle: CHI '95: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: Malcolm I. Bauer
authors.institution: Department of Computer Science and HCI Institute, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA

authors.name: Bonnie E. John
authors.institution: Departments of Computer Science and Psychology and HCI Institute, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA

Gong, R. (1993). Validating and refining the GOMS model methodology for software user interface design and evaluation. Ph.D. dissertation, University of Michigan, 1993.

John, B. E. (1988) Contributions to engineering models of human-computer interaction. Doctoral dissertation, Carnegie Mellon University.

John, B. E. & Vera, A. H. (1992) A GOMS analysis for a graphic, machine-paced, highly interactive task. In Proceedings of CHI, 1992 (Monterey, California, May 3- May 7, 1992) ACM, New York, 1992. pp. 251-258.

Vera, A. H., Lewis, R.L., & Lerch, F.J. (1993) Situated decision-making and recognition-based learning: Applying symbolic theories to interactive tasks. Proceedings of the 15th annual conference of the cognitive science society, Boulder, Colorado.
